scientificExplanation: Procrastination isn't laziness—it's emotional regulation failure. Research from Dr. Tim Pychyl (Carleton University) shows procrastinators prioritize mood repair over goal pursuit. Your brain chooses short-term mood improvement (scrolling, Netflix) over long-term goal progress (work, exercise). The prefrontal cortex (planning) loses to the limbic system (immediate pleasure). Willpower depletes throughout the day, making late-day procrastination worse. Breaking the cycle requires external structure, not more motivation.

faqs.question: Why do I procrastinate even when I know it's hurting me?
faqs.answer: Your brain prioritizes short-term mood repair over long-term goals (neuroscience, not character flaw). When task triggers anxiety/boredom, brain seeks immediate relief (phone, Netflix). Breaking cycle requires external structure (NooLife's task system) that works when willpower is zero.
